title: Seriously this is getting a little ridiculous with the reporting people for talking trash
body: Online gaming wouldn't be what it is today without trash talking. I HAD a lvl 30 account i've had for 6 years and i've never had a problem with getting banned very often, id receive reports here and there for the occasional tilt. Then somehow in the last few months i get a 14 day ban 2 chat bans and a perma ban in 2 months..... like for real Riot? Cant even say someone sucks anymore without getting 5 reports. idk if its the Babyshit soft community or the overly strict rules of Riot but it really has taken the fun out of the game for me.... i cant even have a back and forth with other summoners while competing? Has anyone ever been on a team and competed for something before? there is trash talking. alot of it. most of the time not very nice. i don't get why people get banned for it when they can just be muted and have chat filters to block out all the cursing if it really offends someone that much. i get if you are being racist/sexist/homophobic or just being a strait dick for absolutely no reason. but just saying someone is shit playing like a shit feeder gets me permanently banned? Come on people. I just got another ban on this account for talking shit to someone who was intentionally feeding bc they didnt get the lane they wanted. but i said some "oh no bad words!" and i got a ban for it and that asshat got one too for feeding on purpose. obviously people want to say stuff to those people. why would you encourage us to not interact with the person ruining the game im playing and making it not fun. you guys really care that much about the intentional feeders feeling after wasting 9 other real peoples time bc they dont get the lane they want? I say you tell everyone to stop acting like a bunch of soft babies and quit crying when someone says they are playing like trash. ill take all the criticism given to me right on the chin but it seems as if no one else can.

replies.body:
Locking this thread, as it appears to be pretty old.

If you have any questions about this moderation, feel free to reach out to us in the [Boards Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification).

To put it simply, the average player doesn't want to be forced to play with an asshole for 20-60min. Muting a player doesn't change the presence of the asshole, they're still there. So, for the sake of the enjoyment of a vast majority of players, Riot expects people to behave with civility.

If you want to consider it socially acceptable to be a jerk, you're free to think so. But regardless of your views of what is and isn't socially acceptable behavior, you're still expected to follow the rules if you want to play the game.

yea i get that. but how can i be reported for saying something to someone who is intentionally feeding. or get reported by a group que who after they game all says you were a flaming troll bc you disagreed on something in game and they turn on you like a group of 12 year olds would? how does one stop that?

Just because someone is playing badly or talking smack to you doesnt mean you get a free pass to talk back to them or belittle them without having you also potentially face consequences the same as they do. People tell others to grow a thicker skin, but those same people need to grow their own thick skin so they dont get triggered by trivial things so they dont resort to flaming and such.

all i gotta say is that its clear this community isnt for me. i cant say one bad thing in any game or ill get banned is what it really seems like. all it take is a group queue or some sensitive nancy boys will report me bc im aggressive when i give advice and curse just bc thats what my mind thinks to say in heated competitive situations. but hey.... guess i need to work on softening my words a bit.... but i guess its time to leave LoL in the past. its to PC for me anymore.... used to be fun.

Well, I just suggest that you dont be so harsh on people. Instead of criticizing, just tell them nicely what they could have done and then tell them "its okay though" or i dont know something like that help make it seem you arent trying to bash them. If they want to take it the wrong way, then well whatever, just dont ignore them for the rest of the game.

And if someone wants to be dick to you, just dont say anything and just mute and report at the end.

Hiding behind the anonymity of the Internet while spewing toxic bullshit is working less and less. Looks like your practices have finally caught up to you.

Disagree? Chat logs, please.
id spew the same stuff in person. when people do dumb stuff i tell them its dumb and why it was dumb. if thats a bannable oofense then later nerds. this game aint for me.
And we'll never know what "stuff" this was unless you post your chat logs, so I have no idea what point you're trying to make.

Saying stuff like "why the fuck are you guys charging mid and dying over and over again like morons." Will get you permanently banned even if that's the only negative thing you said all game. Or pointing out bad plays people shouldn't be making and everyone tilts and reports you.

I didn't ask for a sample, I asked for your chat logs.

Since you made this thread, I can only assume you wanted vindication, sympathy, agreement, understanding, or something along those lines. You don't want to just scream into the void. But frankly, I don't believe for a minute that you got banned for minor stuff, unless you spammed and harassed with that minor stuff, making it significantly less minor. I know that because I'm personally guilty of talking shit in plenty of my games, yet while you are banned, I've never had so much as a restriction. 

And I don't expect that this shit flies in real life either, for the record. A successful boss doesn't berate and harass his employee for hours on end over mistakes, he mentors and teaches them instead. If your coworker fucks up, you're expected to figure out a way to coexist with them, not to draw a line in the sand and make everything about the drama between the two of you. If the idiot in front of you in line for coffee can't make up their damn mind, you can nudge them along and voice your displeasure without cursing them out in public or calling them a slur.

First of all, I don't give a rats ass what you believe. Second, I'm not gonna waste my time trying to dig up my old reports so people like you can take offense to words again. All I im saying is i wasn't malicious. If I ever went off mean on someone they were ruining the game for everyone besides themselves and I get banned. Ignore me mute Me if you don't want me to say stuff to you. Why say anything back if you are just going to report me for harrassment. And I've never gotten an email from riot one time I'm looking through my new email from this account. I got a fucking chat ban on this one too bc I was being harassed and telling them to shut the fuck up and play and I get a chat ban. This community is just ass backwards fucked if you ask me.

> [{quoted}](name=SourDeezNutts,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=000600000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-11T18:31:10.515+0000)
> This community is just ass backwards fucked_ if you ask me._

Nobody asked you. 

You're welcome to present your opinion, but you've repeatedly refused to offer evidence to support it when asked. So for the third time I ask: What was your intent in making this thread?
Well like I said before I just looked through my email and I have nothing

> [{quoted}](name=SourDeezNutts,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-01-11T01:20:02.585+0000)
>

You won't be missed.
Now you can play patty cake with the other 12 years Olds free of cursing and full of inting and people who don't know how to not freak out and win a game after losing lane.

> id spew the same stuff in person

and at some point you would meet someone who would smash the shit out of you for that. If you parents missed to teach you something, someone else will.

> [{quoted}](name=CooL Ice Tea,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=000600000001,timestamp=2017-01-11T07:12:44.639+0000)
>
> and at some point you would meet someone who would smash the shit out of you for that. If you parents missed to teach you something, someone else will.

lmao what if i were, hypothetically, a 6'1 lightweight TKD fighter who has been doing it since he was 12? how many people would honestly smash the shit out of my face. other than the few people built like->{{champion:420}}

It's not about physical reprisals. At least, not only about that.

People that can't figure out how to interact in a non-toxic manner aren't tolerated in real life society, much of the time. You can come up with exceptions, sure, but it certainly happens. People get asked to not return to certain bars or restaurants, they routinely get in trouble with the HR department of their job and may have fewer opportunities because of it, they get skipped over for management positions, police aren't inclined to let them off with warnings, they blow interviews, etc. Trump managed to get elected, but look at how many millions of people refused to vote for him based on things he said.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00060000000100010001,timestamp=2017-01-11T22:01:16.235+0000)
>
> It's not about physical reprisals. At least, not only about that.
> 
> People that can't figure out how to interact in a non-toxic manner aren't tolerated in real life society, much of the time. You can come up with exceptions, sure, but it certainly happens. People get asked to not return to certain bars or restaurants, they routinely get in trouble with the HR department of their job and may have fewer opportunities because of it, they get skipped over for management positions, police aren't inclined to let them off with warnings, they blow interviews, etc. Trump managed to get elected, but look at how many millions of people refused to vote for him based on things he said.

none of that is caused by being mean to someone in a game. 

the thing is that people on both sides take the game too seriously, the trolls and flamers are taking to a negative extreme and then the "goodies" are taking to a different extreme, trying to thought police in game with reports based on what you personally think is offensive, in a way to passive aggressively get back at the former group.

i can absolutely admit that i say negative comments in my games, and ive recently been chatbanned, but i think that there are some instances where the system seems too subjective as to what is reportable, and the context things are in.

take what i say with a grain of salt however.

Fair point that I wasn't using game examples, but how about sports?

Poor sportsmanship can result in penalties like a technical foul in basketball or an unsportsmanlike conduct call in American football. In some cases, it even results in the offending player getting ejected from the game. Plus, pros can sometimes face fines for their conduct.

And in the case of one's own team, real people are virtually always expected to act with courtesy for each other. After all, you're a team. Coaches encourage and enforce this at all levels. Haven't you heard about pro players getting benched or even cut for failing to get along with their teammates? 

Ultimately, I truly believe that the level of shit-talking that takes place in games like League is simply a product of anonymity. People are comfortable wishing terrible things upon their opponents or berating their teammates into oblivion for making a mistake or performing poorly, because they used to never get punished for it the way the ABSOLUTELY WOULD if they pulled that kind of shit in the real world.

Well, gaming companies like Riot are starting to catch up with the standards that society holds.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=0006000000010001000100000000,timestamp=2017-01-11T23:54:19.098+0000)
>

> 
> Poor sportsmanship can result in penalties like a technical foul in basketball or an unsportsmanlike conduct call in American football. In some cases, it even results in the offending player getting ejected from the game. Plus, pros can sometimes face fines for their conduct.
>

Haven't you heard about pro players getting benched or even cut for failing to get along with their teammates? 
> 
> Ultimately, I truly believe that the level of shit-talking that takes place in games like League is simply a product of anonymity. People are comfortable wishing terrible things upon their opponents or berating their teammates into oblivion for making a mistake or performing poorly, because they used to never get punished for it the way the ABSOLUTELY WOULD if they pulled that kind of shit in the real world.
> 
> Well, gaming companies like Riot are starting to catch up with the standards that society holds.

you are still taking this too seriously in one direction or the other, all im saying is that there is an overboard, to both ends, you can either shit talk too much, or not be thick skinned enough, I feel like people are taking (sometimes obviously) joking critiques and minor badmouthing far too seriously

Sure, there are some people in this game that just need to be more thick-skinned. But I don't think that's the situation here. OP refuses to post chat logs, after all, and when people DO post their logs, I rarely if ever see things their way. 

Whiny players tilting and calling for reports because somebody admonished them happens, but those reports don't accomplish anything. For all the bashing Riot's punishment system endures, I honestly never see it go wrong when dealing with chat violations. It leaves something to be desired in cases of scripting/inting/etc., but those are understandably harder to detect. 

At the end of the day, one person doesn't get to dictate how others think and feel about their words. One person can use racial and homophobic slurs in a casual fashion without intending to hurt anybody, but maybe somebody else in the game was actually called those words with hateful weight behind them throughout school and doesn't want to continue to deal with that while playing League. Maybe one person is used to talking smack when people fuck up and doesn't think twice about it, but for another player, getting harassed for ten straight minutes because of a lapse of judgment, failure to react, or even just some lag caused them to die in a silly way. 

It's not too much to demand basic courtesy in a video game. Shit.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=000600000001000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T01:04:17.749+0000)
>
> Sure, there are some people in this game that just need to be more thick-skinned. But I don't think that's the situation here. OP refuses to post chat logs, after all, and when people DO post their logs, I rarely if ever see things their way.

For all the bashing Riot's punishment system endures, I honestly never see it go wrong when dealing with chat violations. It leaves something to be desired in cases of scripting/inting/etc., but those are understandably harder to detect. 
>

One person can use racial and homophobic slurs in a casual fashion without intending to hurt anybody, but maybe somebody else in the game was actually called those words with hateful weight behind them throughout school and doesn't want to continue to deal with that while playing League. Maybe one person is used to talking smack when people fuck up and doesn't think twice about it, but for another player, getting harassed for ten straight minutes because of a lapse of judgment, failure to react, or even just some lag caused them to die in a silly way. 
> 
> It's not too much to demand basic courtesy in a video game. Shit.

my basic courtesy is shit talking like they are my buds.
That's not basic courtesy. In fact, that's the opposite of basic courtesy. Showing courtesy to strangers involves NOT assuming that they're your buds.

> [{quoted}](name=Jo0o,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00060000000100010001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T02:23:05.171+0000)
>
> That's not basic courtesy. In fact, that's the opposite of basic courtesy. Showing courtesy to strangers involves NOT assuming that they're your buds.

thats why i said MY basic courtesy

This is what I'm saying. Reports are  used for malicious reasons are probably just as common. And without peers reading it over and deciding if the anger from that match warrants you to get a ban then so be it. But leaving it up to in game trolls and a computer program that bans you off of trigger words thend it's not gonna end up being fair.
So, are you?

> [{quoted}](name=CooL Ice Tea,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00060000000100010000,timestamp=2017-01-11T19:22:25.277+0000)
>
> So, are you?

yeah i am

If someone tried to smash the shit out of me for saying they sucked at a game I would laugh strait in Thier face and fight them as soon as they took a swing. That's a childish reason to wanna fight/ permanently ban someone from a  game for giving you a hard time about feeding your ass off or inting. I just like how rito doesn't even have humans doing the banning. Just some random computer with trigger words that auto bans you. Stupid. And it's so easy just tone it that report out of just being pure salty you got beat/out played alot and will ointment some troll in reporting someone. The set up is stupid and unfair.

Your idea of your whole life concept seems to be that if someone is not doing whatever you want you can shit talk that person into the ground and they have no real option to fight against that expect shit talk you back. 

Means you want to get away free since you are a person which doesn't mind getting shit talked. Are you aware the fact that people out there kill themselves for stuff like that? I mean not over the internet but if you would "flame" the wrong person in real life they would probably feel terrible.

Everyone is different, I wouldn't even care if someone would damage my car by an accident, other people would go insane and try to hurt this stranger. If you want to shit talk me then I would laugh in your face. If you would shit talk a friend of mine he would get depressed.

> [{quoted}](name=SourDeezNutts,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-01-11T01:20:02.585+0000)
>
> id spew the same stuff in person. when people do dumb stuff i tell them its dumb and why it was dumb. 

And I bet you've never held down a job for longer than 6 months.  Your resume must be an instant file to the garbage for any hiring manager.  Unless they were super desperate and willing to take someone they knew they'd fire in a couple of months, which does happen.

Yea well I say you should bet less. I agree sometimes my harsh even In real life. But I don't get why that matters. Being babysit soft gets you nowhere. And when there is nothing done to fix the problems in the game then it's time to leave. I've never seen an intent feeder in HOTS or in any other online game for that matter. League is doesn't take care of thier real problems like making queuse even and pairings players with the me skill level on teams.

> [{quoted}](name=SourDeezNutts,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-01-10T20:31:11.670+0000)
>
I just got another ban on this account for talking shit to someone who was intentionally feeding bc they didnt get the lane they wanted. but i said some &quot;oh no bad words!&quot; and i got a ban for it 

Toxicity bans are not given out for a single match, unless it's a case of extremely offensive harassment or hate speech.  It's more likely that this match was the straw that broke the camel's back, so to speak.  If you have received this many punishments recently, that is a sign from Riot that the behaviors you have been displaying are no longer acceptable.  The problem is not that other people are too sensitive and cannot take your trash-talk.  The problem is that you are not listening when Riot point blank tells you to stop treating the other players in your matches this way.  And after Riot tells you to stop 3 times and you don't, they do not tell you again.  They simply take the account away.  

You ask if anyone has ever been on a team and competed for anything before.  When I was in high school I competed in Track & Field, Cross Country, Cheerleading, and was part of a nationally ranked competition Choir.  When I was in college I competed in national and international Judo tournaments and I've competed against two different Olympic athletes.  Yes, I've competed.  

Trash-talking is not necessary.  It does not make you play better, it does not make your teammates play any better, and it's dishonorable to the spirit of sportsmanship.  Many competitive sports not only discourage trash-talking and negative behavior, they actively punish players for it.  Why do you think players can no longer spike footballs in the NFL or excessively dance in the endzone?  They'd be fined thousands of dollars for it.  If someone spouted off some of the things I've read in chat logs in this board at an Olympic Judo match, they would be disqualified and thrown out.

thats not competing on a team first of all besides cheer leading. in what instance would you trash talk in choir or a 1v1 sport? or track? but i guess since its a free online game their are probably a lot of emotionally unstable pople stuck on thier computer screens for a life and cant stand to see a curse word on their screen. o well. guess this isnt the community for me. bunch of sissies.

> [{quoted}](name=SourDeezNutts,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gbH8eGuI,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-01-11T01:06:37.318+0000)
>

> in what instance would you trash talk in choir or a 1v1 sport? or track?
 
You'd be surprised how competitive choir can be. I'm saying this from the point of view of a guy whose school normally ranked high in our regional and state competitions. Seriously, it can be pretty cutthroat. 

1v1 sports are as competitive and shit talking as it gets. Sure, there isn't a team to badmouth, but isn't the point to be honorable in victory and graceful in defeat (aka don't be an ass?)

And track? Don't get me started. Where I come from, it was always competitive. No one decided to be an asshole. Sure, there was messing around. But I grew up in a _very_ small area. The whole everyone knows everyone. So, we could mess with each other because we knew it wouldn't hurt anyone.

But on the internet, it is WAY different. You don't know the people your mistreating. You have no clue how it could affect them. So finally:

>bunch of sissies.
Is it so damn hard to ask you to have the smallest _sliver_ of human decency? All you have to do is keep your mouth shut, or at the least don't be an ass.

If you can't manage that, then this community is no place for you.

Best of luck
P Fizz

No one is even getting the point of this. Which is another reason why I can't believe this community. Talking shit is fun when it's not being personal or making the other person into something lesser. I don't make fun of people without regard and make them cry that's stupid. It's mostly ass holes that will have a comback for everything you say and provoke you then report you and get you banned. I don't pick on people unless it's someone who is obviously either inting or completely refusing to coordinate with the team. That's about the only time I ever actually say something mean. But I'm the one that gets permanent banned for stuff like that. Not the ones who are constantly making games uneven and putting people behind and God forbid you get 2 or more of them.

And as always i love to get the trash talk back. It makes the lanes more exciting. But nope. Everyone wants to cry themselves to sleep and report people. Guess the old barber shop trash talk days are over and into the realm of PC everything. Don't want to hurt the fragile state of everyone's psyche.
Do it with friends, then. They'll understand and trash talk you back. Not with random people you dont even know.
"Wah-wah someone reported me for being an asshole, wtf why are people using the report functions properly?"
yea not the case but good one bud. looks like we have another 'reports everyone for everything' summoner on our hands. "oh he said i made a BM. god that cuts me so deep. reported"
clearly you deserved whatever punishment you got. calling me bud is also ironic, because im most likely older than you

And no trash talking doesn't suck it's fun unless you are so overly sensitive you can't hear one bad word on Your name or you will crumble emotionally. Obviously don't take it to far but it can't even get to that point bc people are BH from word 1 anymore.

they can pull reports from any day, so over 6 years you may of just been a "toxic" element, that never improved

Interacting and flaming someone are not the same thing. You can interact with flaming but you can't flame to interact....

Regardless of what happened
an eye for an eye makes the whole world go blind
Submit chat logs

unfortunately i dont have them,,. i use harch words and they would come up for being bannable but thats the problem im hgettinmg at. im not a dickbag to everyone. i curse and tell people when they do dumb stuff and why it was dumb. and children get flamed when someone tells them they did a bad job anymore so i get banned. o well.

I'm not a dickbag to everyone..........

Umm the point is to be not a dickbag in 1st place
Being a keyboard warrior accomplishes nothing
Did you know 90% of the time people who make mistakes realize they made a mistake
All thats needed is to say, "hey man ping next time" not "go die in hell you worthless peice of unpinging shit stain that has ruined the game for everyone" 
Like a small nudge in the right direction is all thats required.
Unloading the cannon of words accomplishes nothing

You keep talking about trash talk, but I don't think you actually know what that is.  Trash talk is never to your own team (except in those cases where the other person is a friend and takes it in the friendly spirit intended).  

When directed at your own team it is harassment.  

When directed at the enemy team it is the verbal equivalent of the jungler ganking top lane, then sitting in the bushes for the player to walk back and ganking them again.  Tilt, but not cause harm (and anyone who thinks words can't hurt was never bullied as a child).  

You can trash talk and still be a good sportsman.  This is a very fine line to walk though and the LOL community is for the most part incapable, so best to just not do it.  

Competition creds: Speech and Competitive One-Act in high school (and if you don't think it was competitive you don't know actors) as well as a long list of friends who were more athletic than me.

I know what trash talk is bud. Some people just don't Ike to hear bad things said about them and I guess it's up to us all to make sure they stay comfy. Even if they constantly ruin games with bad play
